When his best friend, Nick the projectionist, gives him a special ticket to the new Slater film, Danny is magically transported into Jack's world, where the good guys always win. Danny becomes his helper as Jack battles a trio of nefarious bad guys, Benedict (Charles Dance), Vivaldi (Anthony Quinn) and The Ripper (Tom Noonan).(n)

programme.title: I Am Giant: Victor Cruz
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling Victor Cruz's improbable rise to football stardom, the life shattering injury that derailed his career and his dramatic attempt at a comeback, revealing the man behind the mask, as he faces the biggest challenge of his life.(n)

programme.title: Cody the Robosapien
programme.desc: When a 12-year-old boy discovers a broken robot, he finds a zany and powerful new best friend who can change his life for the better but when the evil corporation that funded the robot's creation intervenes, the pair must team up to save their family.(n)

programme.title: Knockin' on Dave's Door
programme.desc: Music legend Bob Dylan flies to London one day to visit his mate Dave Stewart. After getting lost, Bob finally arrives at the address and finds himself waiting for Dave in his flat dutifully being served tea by his girlfriend. But is he really in the right place? Starring Eddie Marsan, Paul Ritter and Katherine Parkinson.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Eve
programme.desc: In this all-star family comedy, a power outage traps six groups of New Yorkers in elevators on Christmas Eve where they find that laughter, romance and a little bit of faith might get them through – and change their lives in unexpected ways. Stars Patrick Stewart and Jon Heder.(n)

programme.title: Street Dance Family
programme.desc: Documentary following Entity - one of UK's most successful and controversial under sixteen street dance crew - who battle to overcome the challenges that face them in their bid for glory on the world stage. Features fly-on-the-wall footage from the training room to international competitions and examines the lives of the trainers, the kids and their families as they compete for the World Championship.(n)

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: When an unseen enemy threatens mankind by taking over their bodies and erasing their memories, Melanie (Saoirse Ronan) risks everything to protect the people she loves — her friends, her brother and her Uncle Jeb (William Hurt).(n)

programme.title: Behold the Monkey
programme.desc: A well-intentioned pensioner restores a fresco in a small Spanish town.(n)

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: Babe returns to Farmer Hoggett's farm, fresh from his victory in the sheepherding contest. After Hoggett is injured and unable to work, Babe must go to the big city to save the day. George Miller returns to direct.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Last Action Hero
programme.desc: Danny Madigan (Austin O'Brien) is a lonely 11-year-old boy who escapes from his bleak reality by glorying in the action adventure movies of his favorite film character, Jack Slater (Arnold Schwarzenegger). When his best friend, Nick the projectionist, gives him a special ticket to the new Slater film, Danny is magically transported into Jack's world, where the good guys always win. Danny becomes his helper as Jack battles a trio of nefarious bad guys, Benedict (Charles Dance), Vivaldi (Anthony Quinn) and The Ripper (Tom Noonan).(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: Autumn In New York
programme.desc: A wealthy, charismatic New York restaurateur (Richard Gere) falls for a much younger hat designer (Winona Ryder) but their relationship is complicated by his philandering ways, his past connection to her family, and her debilitating illness. Jill Hennessey, Anthony LaPaglia, Sherry Stringfield and Elaine Stritch costar in this romantic melodrama.(n)

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
programme.desc: Coroner Tommy Tilden and son Austin run a morgue and crematorium in Virginia. When the local sheriff brings in a body found in the basement of a home, it seems like just another open-and-shut case. As the autopsy proceeds however, they are left reeling as the inspection brings new revelations. Perfectly preserved on the outside, Jane Doe seems to have been the victim of a horrific ritualistic torture. Tommy and Austin begin to piece together these gruesome discoveries, as an unnatural force takes hold of the crematorium.

Belle throws herself into a vampire role play, but the appointment comes to a sticky end; Belle and Ben are still frosty with each other, while the predatory Harry and minx-like Poppy are still on the scene.

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Strong Sexual Content

programme.title: Episode 103
programme.desc: Elliott takes advantage of Dylan's sexual prey while Ashley's old beau plays a prank on her. Jules reconnects with a secret affair during her birthday party. Ashley feels an immediate connection to the mysterious Elliott, but when he leaves with another woman wonders if her feelings are one-sided.(c)

programme.title: The Rendezvous
programme.desc: Rachel, a Jewish-American doctor and Jake, an Arab-American government bureaucrat, are trying to solve the mysterious death of Rachel's brother. Racing around the world, they find themselves hunted by a doomsday group. The group believes Rachel and Jake possess an ancient script discovered by Rachel's brother that could bring about the end of days. Caught in the middle of a plot to hasten the end of mankind, Rachel and Jake must solve a murder and save the world.

programme.title: Boogie Woogie
programme.desc: The over-hyped, pretentious modern art scene in London is satirized in this dark ensemble comedy about the double dealings and calculated relationships encircling the effort to get an aging collector to part with a valuable painting. Gillian Anderson, Alan Cumming and Heather Graham star.

programme.title: Rabid
programme.desc: After a young woman has a motorcycle accident that leads to experimental surgery to save her life, she develops a taste for blood that spurs a city-wide zombie epidemic.

programme.title: Osama
programme.desc: The first major motion picture to emerge from Afghanistan following the fall of the repressive Taliban regime is the story of a young girl (Marina Golbahari) struggling to survive in the early days of the Taliban's patriarchal rule by disguising herself as a boy. Siddiq Barmak's powerful drama won the Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film and an honorable mention at the Cannes Film Festival.

programme.title: The Dog Lover
programme.desc: Sara Gold is a young girl on a quest to save man's best friend. When she goes undercover to take down a dog breeder suspected of wrongdoing, she quickly finds out she might be on the wrong side of right. Sara must make a decision: to continue and follow the orders of her organization, United Animal Protection Agency, or trust her instincts and the boy she's fallen in love with.

programme.title: Against the Current
programme.desc: Justin Kirk and Joseph Fiennes star in this independent drama about a middle-aged man who decides to fulfill a childhood dream of swimming 150 miles of the Hudson River with his best friend rowing alongside for encouragement, but a bittersweet hidden agenda for the feat is gradually revealed. Mary Tyler Moore costars.

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.

programme.title: Body
programme.desc: After three twenty-something girls break into a mansion and inadvertently murder the groundskeeper, they slowly self-destruct as they decide what to do with the dead body in the living room.

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Academy Award®-winning director Robert Zemeckis creates an adventure about two women, Academy Award®-winners Meryl Streep and Goldie Hawn, determined to win the heart of the same man, Bruce Willis. When they both drink an immortality potion, their mutual murder plans get a little complicated.

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: Collide
programme.desc: Casey, a young American backpacker in Germany, falls in love with Juliette, a fellow American traveling through Europe. She is diagnosed with a fatal disease, and Casey decides to steal from German gangster Hagen, in order to pay for the medical treatment which could save Juliette's life. Casey's heist doesn't go as planned and Hagen catches him. He manages to escape Hagen's men, steal one of Hagen's cars, and flee. Pursued across Germany, he races to save his own life and get to Juliette before Hagen's men get to her first.

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.

In the Season 4 finale, the series comes to a conclusion as Ben asks Belle to quit her profession, throwing her life into turmoil and leading to further complication when she meets a client who seems strangely familiar.(c)

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Strong Sexual Content

programme.title: Episode 104
programme.desc: Ashley's relationship with Elliot heats up while Jules challenges Scarlett to end her marriage. Dylan's arrangement with Elliott grows more strained when she provides him with an unwanted gift. When Ashley poses nude for Scarlett she uncovers the truth about her feelings for Jules. Dylan begins sensing a threat to her domain.(c)

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: Return To Me
programme.desc: After he suffers the devastating loss of his beloved wife Elizabeth, a Chicago building contractor (David Duchovny) unknowingly falls in love with the woman (Minnie Driver) who received Elizabeth's transplanted heart. Carroll O'Connor, James Belushi, Robert Loggia, Joely Richardson, David Alan Grier and Bonnie Hunt (who also wrote and directed) costar in this charming romantic comedy-drama.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: Osama
programme.desc: The first major motion picture to emerge from Afghanistan following the fall of the repressive Taliban regime is the story of a young girl (Marina Golbahari) struggling to survive in the early days of the Taliban's patriarchal rule by disguising herself as a boy. Siddiq Barmak's powerful drama won the Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film and an honorable mention at the Cannes Film Festival.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: When fifteen-year-old Shay (Daniel Huttlestone) hears the music of The Clash for the first time, it's a revelation, opening up a new world of anti-establishment defiance beyond anything he's known in his dead-end London suburb. Drawn into the heart of the city's burgeoning punk scene, he forges two relationships that will change his life: falling in love with rebellious cool girl Vivian (Nell Williams) and finding an unexpected connection with none other than The Clash's electrifying frontman, Joe Strummer (Jonathan Rhys Meyers).

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: When a displaced Indian family opens a restaurant in the south of France, just 100 feet from a Michelin star restaurant, a culinary war ensues between the two establishments. Stars Academy Award® winner Helen Mirren.

programme.title: The Preacher's Wife
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as an angel named Dudley sent to Earth to help a minister's marriage (Courtney B. Vance) to his wife (Whitney Houston). Things take a twist when Dudley accidentally falls in love with her.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.(n)

programme.title: Episode 105
programme.desc: Ashley visits Elliot's bondage cellar for the first time. Jules makes a stunning pronouncement. A devastating argument with Elliott forces Dylan into the arms of a past lover, Adam, where some deep-rooted secrets are revealed. Meanwhile, Ashley and Jules stretch their sexual boundaries in ways they never expected as Dylan plots her revenge.(n)

programme.title: Episode 106
programme.desc: Dylan proves that a woman scorned is a dangerous creature when a shocking encounter between she and Ashley tests their emotional limits. Jules makes an important, life-changing decision. Raif reveals an amusing story about his sexual past. Elliott and Ashley's relationship faces a watershed moment. Season finale.(n)

programme.title: Palm Swings
programme.desc: Married couple Allison and Mark Hughes moving into their new Palm Springs home. Claire and Jim Ericson are their charismatic new neighbors. Claire, a sensual ex-model, and Jim, a music producer, embody the passionate marriage that Allison wants. Unable to sleep one night, Allison spies with her camera a woman arriving to meet Jim next door. Allison investigates and discovers their neighbors are swingers. Her and Mark get more than they bargained for when their wild adventures threaten to destroy their marriage.(n)

programme.title: The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus
programme.desc: Doctor Parnassus (Christopher Plummer) is cursed with a dark secret. Thousands of years ago he made a bet with the devil, Mr. Nick (Tom Waits), in which he won immortality. Centuries later, on meeting his one true love, Dr. Parnassus made another deal with the devil, trading his immortality for youth, on condition that when his daughter reaches her 16th birthday, she will become the property of Mr. Nick. His daughter is now rapidly approaching the age milestone and Dr. Parnassus is desperate to protect her from her impending fate.(n)

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.(n)

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).(n)

programme.title: Who Gets the Dog?
programme.desc: After deciding to call their marriage quits, Olive (Alicia Silverstone) and Clay (Ryan Kwanten) both want custody of their beloved dog Wesley. Facing a court-ordered 60-day review to determine who'll get the pooch, Olive and Clay try their doggone best to win over the judge in this romantic comedy about what happens when puppy love goes to the dogs.(n)

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: After spending two decades in prison for a crime he didn't commit, Mo (Boyd Holbrook) struggles to put his past behind him and readjust to a new life. Doris (Elisabeth Moss) is trapped in another sort of prison: an abusive marriage. When a dramatic encounter brings them together, Mo soon finds himself risking everything—including being locked up once again for someone else's crime—to protect the fragile Doris. Academy Award® winner Octavia Spencer and Sung Kang costar.(n)

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful (La vita e bella)
programme.desc: Guido is a charming, bumbling Jewish waiter whose colorful imagination and playful spirit help him to woo a beautiful schoolteacher. The couple marries and has a young son, but before long, their idyllic world is threatened by Nazi soldiers who force the family into a concentration camp. Guido must now use his imagination again - this time to transform his son's tragic new surroundings into a magical wonderland.(n)

programme.title: Ping Pong Summer
programme.desc: In this coming of age comedy, a family vacation during the summer of 1985 changes everything for a shy teenage boy obsessed with ping pong.(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Hard-to-please Aurora (Shirley MacLaine) is looking for love, while her daughter (Debra Winger) has her own set of family problems. Also starring Jack Nicholson.(n)

programme.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
programme.desc: This insightful, hysterically funny documentary follows comedienne Joan Rivers through a year of her life while looking back on her groundbreaking, barrier-breaking career as one of the first women to make a name for herself in the tough, male-dominated world of show business.(n)

programme.title: Mercy (2010)
programme.desc: A writer (Scott Caan) of highly sentimental love stories is secretly a womanizing cynic who has never actually experienced love, until he meets the beautiful and shockingly straightforward critic Mercy (Wendy Glenn), who is not fooled by his phony mawkishness. Erika Christensen costars in this romantic drama.(n)

programme.title: Jungle Jim
programme.desc: Big-screen "Tarzan" Johnny Weissmuller donned some clothes to become the titular hero in the first entry in the series, where he leads an African safari to obtain a rare drug known to be located in a pyramid near a hidden native village.

programme.title: The Lost Tribe
programme.desc: Jungle Jim (Johnny Weissmuller) vs. villains who would seize the treasures of a "hidden city" in Africa. Norina: Myrna Dell. Li Wanna: Elena Verdugo. Chot: Paul Marion. Calhoun: Joseph Vitale. Rawling: Ralph Dunn. Directed by William Berke.

programme.title: Mark of the Gorilla
programme.desc: Jungle Jim (Johnny Weissmuller) vs. thieves in gorilla skins. Suzanne Dalbert, Trudy Marshall, Onslow Stevens, Robert Purcell. William Berke directed.

programme.title: Nostradamus Says So
programme.desc: The prophecies of Nostradamus are interpreted to predict major events of the 20th century.

programme.title: Captive Girl
programme.desc: Leopard goddesses and underwater treasure spark the action in this Jungle Jim (Johnny Weissmuller) yarn. Barton: Buster Crabbe. Joan: Anita Lhoest. Mahala: Rick Vallin. Directed by William Berke.

programme.title: Pygmy Island
programme.desc: Jungle Jim (Johnny Weissmuller) takes on enemy agents while searching for a missing WAC officer. Ann Savage, David Bruce, Steven Geray, William Tannen. William Berke directed.

programme.title: Johannesburg 'City of Gold'
programme.desc: Johannesburg in South Africa is visited for a look at the gold-mining industry and a study of the local culture, music and dance. Narrated by James A. Fitzpatrick.

programme.title: In the Land of Diamonds
programme.desc: A visit to South Africa, including a stop at Cape Town. Narrated by James A. Fitzpatrick.

programme.title: Bomba, the Jungle Boy
programme.desc: A young girl, lost in the wilds of Africa, is befriended by a teenage Tarzan. Johnny Sheffield, who played Boy in many of the Johnny Weissmuller "Tarzan" adventures, has the title role in this first of 12 films in the "Bomba" series. (cc).

programme.title: Bomba on Panther Island
programme.desc: Jungle Boy (Johnny Sheffield) on the trail of a killer panther. Lita Baron, Allene Roberts, Charles Irwin. Average. Directed by Ford Beebe. (cc).

programme.title: The Lost Volcano
programme.desc: Third entry in the "Bomba" series has the jungle boy battling hunting guides who kidnap his young friend and force him to lead them to a hidden city and a treasure beneath an active volcano. (cc).(c)

programme.title: Calling on Cape Town
programme.desc: A look at Cape Town, South Africa, includes the history of its settlers. (repeat).(c)

programme.title: Bomba and the Hidden City
programme.desc: Jungle Boy (Johnny Sheffield) is pitted against a villainous chieftain (Paul Guilfoyle). Raschid: Leon Belasco. Leah: Sue England. Directed by Ford Beebe. (cc).

programme.title: The Lion Hunters
programme.desc: Entry in the "Bomba, the Jungle Boy" series pits the young hero against corrupt animal trappers. (cc).

programme.title: Elephant Stampede
programme.desc: Jungle Boy Bomba (Johnny Sheffield) adventure involving greedy ivory hunters. Directed by Ford Beebe. (cc).(c)

programme.title: Picturesque South Africa
programme.desc: This entry in the "Traveltalk" series visits South Africa for a look at the people, customs, culture, history and scenic spots.(c)

programme.title: African Treasure
programme.desc: Entry in the "Bomba the Jungle Boy" series has the young hero battling diamond smugglers in the African wilds. (cc).

programme.title: Bomba and the Jungle Girl
programme.desc: A "Bomba the Jungle Boy" adventure in which he sets out to learn who murdered his parents. (cc).

programme.title: Safari Drums
programme.desc: Entry in the "Bomba the Jungle Boy" series in which he tries to solve a murder involving documentary makers in Africa. (cc).

programme.title: The Golden Idol
programme.desc: Bomba the Jungle Boy adventure in which the valiant hero is asked to retrieve a stolen artifact. (cc).

programme.title: Killer Leopard
programme.desc: A jungle dweller helps a film star search for her husband. (cc).

programme.title: Lord of the Jungle
programme.desc: The final entry in the Bomba the Jungle Boy film series has the young hero trying to halt the slaughter of a herd of rogue elephants. (cc).

programme.title: The Blue Angel
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich plays a tawdry cabaret singer (introducing the song "Falling in Love Again") who becomes the object of obsession for a highly moral, elderly professor.

programme.title: The Scarlet Empress
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich in Josef von Sternberg's stylized interpretation of the legend of Catherine the Great. Empress Elizabeth: Louise Dresser. Grand Duke Peter: Sam Jaffe. Prince August: C. Aubrey Smith. Alexei: John Lodge. Johanna: Olive Tell. Countess: Ruthelma Stevens. Orlov: Gavin Gordon. Colorful cast, bizarre production, dazzling sets and costumes. A cinematic feast. (cc).

programme.title: Shanghai Express
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee about political intrigue, murder, espionage and romance aboard a train rolling through 1931 China during the country's civil war. (cc).(c)

programme.title: Glimpses of Morocco and Algiers
programme.desc: Short travelogue visiting the North African countries of Morocco and Algiers (now Algeria).(c)

programme.title: Morocco
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich is at her most provocative in this entertaining tale of the romance between a legionnaire and a trollop. Adolphe Menjou, Ulrich Haupt, Juliette Compton, Paul Porcasi. Josef Von Sternberg directed. (cc).

programme.title: Blonde Venus
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich as a German cabaret singer in the States whose husband, Ned, falls ill and his only hope is to receive expensive medical treatment at a clinic in Europe. Struggling to afford his care and to support their son, she works at a nightclub and succumbs to the advances of a wealthy playboy, whose gifts assist in her husband's recovery. The film contains the well-known scenes where Dietrich performs stage numbers in a gorilla suit and a white tuxedo (complete with top hat). (cc).

programme.title: Masks and Memories
programme.desc: Elderly Andy mistakes the beautiful young Julie for a former flame from decades before, but she prompts him to go to a party and stop living in the past. (cc).

programme.title: MGM Parade
programme.desc: George Murphy introduces clips from "The Great Ziegfeld," with Ray Bolger, and "The Tender Trap," with Debbie Reynolds.

programme.title: The Unholy Three
programme.desc: Silent thriller about a trio of sideshow performers who turn their talents to larceny. Lon Chaney stars as a ventriloquist who disguises himself as an old lady who sells parrots that appear to talk, thanks to him throwing his voice. Remade by Chaney as a 1930 talkie, his first and last.(c)

programme.title: Equestrian Acrobatics
programme.desc: Entry in the "A Pete Smith Specialty" series features the Cristiani Family, a circus act whose members leap from one moving horse to another while performing acrobatic stunts. Pete Smith is the narrator.(c)

programme.title: The Unknown
programme.desc: Tod Browning wrote and directed this silent Lon Chaney classic about a criminal on the lam who hides out in a circus and pretends he has no arms.

programme.title: The Show
programme.desc: Love, treachery and murder among carnival performers in Hungary. Directed by Tod Browning. Features a new score by Darrell Raby, winner of TCM's 2006 Young Film Composers Competition.

programme.title: West of Zanzibar
programme.desc: Lon Chaney gives a commanding performance a disabled magician in Africa, where, for more than 18 years, he plots revenge on the ivory trader (Lionel Barrymore) who caused his paralysis and stole his wife.

programme.title: The Thirteenth Chair
programme.desc: The friend of a murder victim stages a seance to locate the killer.(c)

programme.title: Hot Dog
programme.desc: An all-canine cast stars in this short about a cheating wife who murders her husband and is put on trial for the crime. Directed by Zion Myers and Jules White.(c)

programme.title: Freaks
programme.desc: Tod Browning's cult classic about the relationship between a circus "little person" and the beautiful trapeze artist who marries him for his inheritance, but runs afoul of his fellow sideshow colleagues and their code of honor. Genuine circus and carnival performers were cast as the "freaks." (cc).

programme.title: Fast Workers
programme.desc: Story of two riveters and the woman who breaks up their friendship. Screen idol John Gilbert's last starring vehicle for MGM. Mary: Mae Clarke. Bucker: Robert Armstrong. Spike: Vince Barnett. Millie: Muriel Kirkland. Pink: Sterling Holloway. Directed by Tod Browning. (cc).

programme.title: Mark of the Vampire
programme.desc: Tod Browning directed this remake of his 1927 silent thriller "London After Midnight," but moved the action to a remote Middle European village, where strange evils stalk the inhabitants and a police inspector teams with an occult expert to investigate. (cc).

programme.title: The Devil Doll
programme.desc: Tod Browning's chilling tale of a vengeful, wrongly convicted escapee (Lionel Barrymore) from Devil's Island who opens a "doll" shop of live shrunken humans---who do his dirty work. Browning and Erich von Stroheim scripted. (cc).

programme.title: Miracles for Sale
programme.desc: Horror director Tod Browning's final film is a tale about a magician who comes to the aid of a terrified girl who finds herself in the middle of a fraud, murder and people involved with the supernatural. (cc).

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Three criminals attempt to steal an army shipment of gold bars from a moving locomotive in 19th-century England. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hanover Street
programme.desc: A Yank pilot (Harrison Ford) romances a British nurse (Lesley-Anne Down) during WWII. Christopher Plummer is the husband gone off to war. Trumbo: Alec McCowen. Jerry: Richard Masur. Martin: Michael Sacks. Harry: Max Wall. Directed by Peter Hyams. (cc).(n)

programme.title: From Beyond the Grave

programme.desc: A look at a love triangle in a gay bar in Tokyo. (cc).(n)

programme.title: I Love My Mother-in-Law, But ... *

programme.desc: The jungle man sets out to break up a warlike tribe who dress in leopard skins. Johnny Weissmuller, Brenda Joyce, Johnny Sheffield, Acquanetta. Kimba: Tommy Cook. Lazar: Edgar Barrier. Commissioner: Dennis Hoey. Kurt Neumann directed.(n)

programme.title: Teddy the Rough Rider
programme.desc: Oscar-winning short biopic chronicling the political and military career of Theodore Roosevelt (Sidney Blackmer) from 1895, when he was named New York City police commissioner, to his appointment as President after the 1901 assassination of President McKinley. programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: During World War II, a crack team of six commandos undertakes a suicide mission to destroy two massive German guns that guard a strategic channel in the Aegean Sea and block Allied passage. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Adaptation of the play about royal-family intrigue in 1183 involving King Henry II, his estranged wife Eleanor of Aquitaine and their three sons who make up the line of succession. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Kela Me Keia Manawa (Now and Then)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An elderly man is forced to defend his shop from an armed robbery. The resulting investigation has Lupo and Bernard probing ulterior motives for the crime. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The disfigured body of a campaign volunteer is found with the word "FED" scrawled on his chest, kicking off an investigation that turns up numerous suspects. Rey Curtis: Benjamin Bratt. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Cursed
programme.desc: While visiting a ghost town with her father, Phoebe has visions of a cowboy from the Old West getting beaten up and she begins to suffer from his injuries, which later include a gunshot wound. programme.title: Charmed

Hugh Grant, Colin Firth. A stellar Zellweger was nominated for a Best Actress Oscar. She perfected a British accent and gained 20 pounds for the role. Based on Helen Fielding's novel and followed by the 2004 sequel, “Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason.” Sharon Maguire directed. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: 500 Days of Summer
programme.desc: Greeting-card copywriter Tom falls head over heels for his coworker Summer in this romantic comedy. Tom thinks that he's finally found his soul mate, but Summer claims not to believe in true love and is only interested in having some fun with Tom. The film moves forward and backward through various incidents in Tom and Summer's 500-day love affair. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis (James Marsden and Cameron Diaz) receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: An Amazon princess leaves her island home and journeys to the outside world, which is being consumed by a massive war. With the help of an American pilot, she works to put an end to the conflict. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen traveling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis (James Marsden and Cameron Diaz) receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Ellen Ripley is back in the "Alien" saga's fourth installment. Here she returns from the dead, courtesy of cloning, to battle more vicious beasts. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: X-Men Origins Wolverine
programme.desc: Wolverine returns in this prequel to the popular "X-Men" movie series. This origin story explains how Wolverine discovered his unique powers and the mysterious circumstances behind his retractable metal claws. Numerous characters made famous in the "X-Men" comics also make an appearance, including Sabretooth. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: In a Maine town, a former U.S. president and a handyman vie for the mayor's office and a local woman's affections. The ex-president retires to the small town in order to write his memoirs, but winds up running for mayor against a hardware store owner. Complicating matters is the political bigwig's interest in the handyman's girlfriend. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: She's Out of My League
programme.desc: A kindhearted but socially awkward airport security agent wins the affections of a gorgeous party planner and vows to make the relationship work, despite the misgivings of his friends and family. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: An FBI agent tries to protect an autistic boy from an evil faction of government operatives after the child inadvertently deciphers a national-security code, putting the reputations of certain higher ups in danger. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Alien The Director's Cut
programme.desc: Bonus footage and a revamped soundtrack enhance this version of the Oscar-winning tale about an interstellar cargo ship terrorized by a monstrous stowaway. Suspenseful and terrifying. Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt. Directed by Ridley Scott. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Live by Night
programme.desc: Joe Coughlin, the son of a Boston police lieutenant, moves to Florida during the Prohibition era to become a bootlegger. As his operation grows, Coughlin faces off against local gangsters, Klansmen and religious evangelicals while he fights for control of Tampa's criminal underworld. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: When Mark Whitacre discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing, he becomes an informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be hailed as a hero for his efforts, he agrees to wear a wire and gathers evidence to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when the FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Contrived thriller about dirty-bomb attacks in Los Angeles that leave a couple quarantined, he (Rory Cochrane) inside their house, she (Mary McCormack) on the outside. Tony Perez. Written and directed by Chris Gorak. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Whiteout
programme.desc: U.S. Marshal Carrie Stetko (Kate Beckinsale) races to catch a killer in Antarctica before the sun sets for six months and she gets trapped in the dark with a madman. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: All the Real Girls
programme.desc: A small-town lothario (Paul Schneider) tries to change his ways when he falls in love with his best friend's 18-year-old sister (Zooey Deschanel). Slow paced, but well-acted. Patricia Clarkson. Directed by David Gordon Green. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: A fact-based story of a surgeon who learns the importance of compassion in a physician-patient relationship when he's treated for cancer. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: George Lopez The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Big Miracle
programme.desc: Alaskan newsman Adam Carlson (John Krasinski) and Greenpeace volunteer Rachel Kramer team up to help free a family of gray whales that are trapped in the Arctic Circle in this drama inspired by actual events. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
programme.desc: Dramatic fantasy about a librarian whose genetic disorder causes him to hurtle through time when under extreme duress. Despite this condition, he tries to build a relationship with a young heiress. Based on the best-selling novel by author Audrey Niffenegger. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: A Dangerous Son
programme.desc: A profile of three families who are struggling with a child's severe mental illness highlights the cycle of counselor visits, medications, hospitalizations and encounters with law enforcement; and features interviews with mental-health experts and advocates. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Atomic Blonde
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in 1989 Berlin, MI6 agent Lorraine Broughton must obtain a stolen list of Western spies while the city around her descends into chaos and revolution. In time, her pursuit leads her to uncover a much-larger conspiracy. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Lady Macbeth
programme.desc: In 1865 England, a young woman in a loveless marriage has an affair with a servant on her estate. When her husband and father-in-law discover their tryst, the lovers resort to deception and murder in order to save their relationship. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: This biopic of celebrated physicist Stephen Hawking explores his early years at Cambridge, where he fell in love with liberal-arts student and future wife Jane shortly before being diagnosed with ALS. As the years progress, Jane begins to feel more like a nurse than a spouse, and Hawking develops feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic, a paraplegic war veteran named Jake Sully volunteers for a mission on the planet Pandora, a hostile environment where human beings can only survive by remotely controlling alien avatars. However, Jake soon realizes that the Na'vi, a race of creatures native to Pandora, are being threatened by his own people, and he decides to join them in fighting back against mankind. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: Forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy. (cc).

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. (cc).

programme.title: Ronin
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries led by a former CIA operative is hired by the IRA to recover a mysterious briefcase before it's sold to Russian agents. Before long, the assignment turns into a deadly game of cat and mouse. (cc).

programme.title: Nocturnal Animals
programme.desc: An art-gallery owner reads a novel written by her ex-husband, and becomes greatly disturbed by the possibility that the story was inspired by their marriage and that her safety is in jeopardy. (cc).

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Boston cop Thomas Craven discovers his grown daughter Emma led a double life after she is shot to death on his doorstep. Craven investigates her murder and soon uncovers evidence of corporate cover-ups and a government conspiracy. Meanwhile, mysterious government agent Darius Jedburgh sets out to erase all evidence of the crime. (cc).

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's bumbling son rises from the fiery depths of hell and enters New York City, where he tries to save the world and his father's life by battling his two supremely evil brothers, who are scheming to upset the balance of good and evil. (cc).

programme.title: The Temp
programme.desc: A rising executive hires an assistant who turns out to be highly industrious. Before long, however, the executive's competitors begin dying, and suspicion points to his assistant. (cc).

programme.title: Black Sea
programme.desc: A rogue submarine captain accepts a potentially lucrative offer to retrieve a missing treasure from the Black Sea, despite the sneaking suspicion that he might end up being double-crossed. (cc).

programme.title: Romeo Must Die
programme.desc: Violent take on “Romeo and Juliet” centering on the love affair between a Chinese escaped prisoner (Jet Li) and the daughter of the head of a black crime syndicate. The action packs a punch, but the script is packed with clichés. Pop star Aaliyah (1979-2001) costars and performs four songs on the soundtrack. Isaiah Washington. Andrzej Bartkowiak directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton stars as Davy Crockett and Dennis Quaid is Sam Houston in this somber re-creation of the famous 1836 siege in San Antonio. Historically accurate, but unexciting. Jason Patric, Patrick Wilson. Directed by John Lee Hancock (“The Rookie”). (cc).

programme.title: The Core
programme.desc: A scientist discovers a catastrophic problem with Earth's core, and he and a team of experts embark on a dangerous mission to the middle of the planet in the hopes of averting a global disaster. (cc).

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: A man who goes on the lam after he's wrongly convicted of killing his wife. As he scours the country looking for the true murderer, he is pursued be a relentless U.S. deputy marshal looking to bring him to justice. (cc).

programme.title: Once upon a Time in Mexico
programme.desc: A corrupt CIA agent teams up with a guitar-playing gunslinger to stop a coup South of the Border. (cc).

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).

programme.title: Rellik
programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: The Coen brothers' sly drama about a policewoman (Frances McDormand) who's trying to determine how several murders and a kidnapping are linked to an unassuming car salesman (William H. Macy). Showalter: Steve Buscemi. Grimsrud: Peter Stormare. (cc).

programme.title: The Royal Tenenbaums
programme.desc: A clan's estranged patriarch loses his home and learns that his ex-wife plans to remarry, so he pretends to be dying to win back his family. Although his ex lets him move back in, his three adult children don't react well to their father's return. (cc).

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: This ode to jazz focuses on Bleek Gilliam, a self-absorbed, contemporary trumpet player whose blind devotion to his own talent causes rifts in his professional and personal lives. (cc).

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: A drug shipment is sent to the wrong address, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before its contents are discovered. Brody (Mike Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) have mistakenly received a package containing 10 kilos of cocaine. If they can just find a buyer, they'll be rich. Meanwhile, intended recipients Jesus and Chita attempt to track down the shipment before drug lord Bodego Diablo realizes it's missing. But Bodega already knows the score and he wants his drugs back. (cc).

programme.title: Blood Work
programme.desc: After his heart transplant, a retired FBI profiler tries to solve the organ donor's murder. (cc).

programme.title: Hulk
programme.desc: A genetically mutated scientist's alter ego runs amok in this adaptation of the Marvel comic. (cc).

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes puts his strength and intellect to the test as he teams with Watson to battle Lord Blackwood, a formidable new adversary who is determined to destroy England. (cc).

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: A struggling actor and crook moves to Los Angeles, hoping to score some movie roles, where he meets a gay PI at a party. When a series of female bodies turn up, they find themselves investigating the murders. (cc).

programme.title: U.S. Marshals
programme.desc: Sam Gerard is back chasing another wrongly accused fugitive. This time he's pursuing Mark Sheridan, a Chicago man framed for a double homicide in New York. (cc).

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. (cc).

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the popular video-game series, a death-row convict relives his ancestor's memories as an assassin in 15th-century Spain. From this out-of-body experience, he gains the training he needs to battle a conspiracy in the present day. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A Texas lawman pursues an escaped convict who has kidnapped a young boy. Meanwhile, in their dash to the border, the convict and the boy form a father-son attachment. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Khadijah reminisces about events that put "Flavor" on the map---and the subject of her first cover story (Kareem Abdul-Jabbar). Evander Holyfield has a cameo. Esther: Estelle Harris. Emcee: Susan Taylor. Khadijah: Queen Latifah. (repeat).

programme.title: Living Single
programme.desc: Choir director Kyle has to choose a soloist---off-key friend Regine, or a singer with a "heavenly" voice (CeCe Winans). Rev. Taylor: Dorien Wilson. Mrs. Taylor: Arnetia Walker. Regine: Kim Fields Freeman. Khadijah: Queen Latifah. (repeat).

programme.title: Living Single
programme.desc: Max and Kyle sneak off to a hotel room for a secret getaway, while suspicions mount at home. Max: Erika Alexander. Kyle: T.C. Carson. Overton: John Henton. Khadijah: Queen Latifah. Regine: Kim Fields Freeman. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Shawn spurns his pals for a yuppie crowd and masquerades as an executive, so Marlon sets out to downsize his ego. Parker: Phil Morris. Dupree: Jermaine Hopkins. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Marlon becomes famous in malt-liquor commercials, but there's trouble brewing when he portrays a ghetto stereotype. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Simone: Kimberly Moss. Tom: John Webber. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Marlon wins a vacation for two, but it's no day at the beach when Shawn, Pops and Grandma battle over the second ticket. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. Grandma: Ja'Net Du Bois. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: The brothers concoct a sob story and win a Wish of the Year contest, then have to put on an act when a reporter shows up. Gina: Meta Golding. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Pops: John Witherspoon. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Everyone tells their own version of how Martin and Gina met. Charles: Mirron Willis. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Pam: Tichina Arnold. Bouncer No. 1: Shashawne Hall. Cole: Carl Anthony Payne II. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin is determined to win the "Man of the Decade" award at his high school reunion. Ricky Fontaine: Miguel A. Nunez Jr. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Vanessa: Wendy Robinson. Keisha: Lynette Lane. Tommy: Thomas Mikal Ford. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: When the cat (Gina) is away, the mice (Martin, Tommy and Cole) try to play---and so does the cat. Seymour Butts: Cameron W. Jones. Raul: Luis Antonio Ramos. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Pam: Tichina Arnold. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin has the gang over to watch boxing, but it's Cole's new relationship that's on the ropes when his girlfriend (Bridgid Coulter) desires Tommy. Martin Lawrence. Tommy: Thomas Mikal Ford. Brother Man: Reginald Ballard. Stan: Garrett Morris. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: After Monique (Kim Fields) turns Will down, Jazz thinks he has a way to change her mind. Jazz: Jeffrey A. Townes. Will: Will Smith. Philip: James Avery. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Tom Jones plays Carlton's guardian angel when Carlton's hopes of getting into Princeton are dashed by Will. Ed: Earl Boen. Carlton: Alfonso Ribeiro. Will: Will Smith. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will learns a sobering lesson after Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) pops pills from Will's locker. John: Mark Ballou. Nurse Irene: Edye Byrde. Cindy: Mary Morrow. Vanessa: Johari. Will: Will Smith. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Vivian goes into labor, and her sisters (Vernee Watson-Johnson, Charlayne Woodard) are elsewhere. Vivian: Janet Hubert-Whitten. Geoffrey: Joseph Marcell. Philip: James Avery. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will and Carlton encounter heavyweight boxing champ Riddick Bowe in a funky cafe-casino. Lola: Olivia Brown. Homer: Steve Nevil. Jazz: Jeffrey A. Townes. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew
programme.desc: Ceaser and the crew crash Sky's vacation in Miami. Kitty launches an attack on Ceaser. Alex reveals his true feelings to Donna and an unexpected guest shows up seeking revenge. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew
programme.desc: The crew continues to turn up on South Beach. Alex is rushed to the emergency room after he collapses on the beach. Jadah and Tati come to blows. Ceaser throws a Scarfaced-themed party to impress a girl. (repeat).

programme.title: Roll Bounce
programme.desc: Amiable, entertaining coming-of-age tale anchored by the strain between a widower (Chi McBride) and his son (Bow Wow), who's caught up in the roller-disco scene in 1970s Chicago. Wesley Jonathan. Directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Wayne Brady has a blast as a roller-rink DJ, and Mike Epps and Charlie Murphy get laughs as garbage collectors.

programme.title: B.A.P.S.
programme.desc: Two Black American Princesses (Halle Berry, Natalie Desselle) head for L.A. to audition for a music video, but end up in a scam perpetrated by the nephew of a wealthy man (Martin Landau). Manley: Ian Richardson. Tracy: Troy Beyer. Antonio: Luigi Amodeo. Directed by Robert Townsend.

programme.title: Space Jam
programme.desc: Basketball's Michael Jordan teams up with Bugs Bunny (voice of Billy West) in this sunny blend of animation and live action about aliens plotting to kidnap Bugs for their failing theme park, Moron Mountain. Other voices include Danny DeVito, Kath Soucie. Directed by Joe Pytka. (repeat).

programme.desc: When a pro-basketball star (Miguel A. Nunez Jr.) gets tossed out of the league, he dresses as a female hoopster and joins a women's team. The film nets too few laughs. Vivica A. Fox. Features cameos by NBA players Tyrone Bogues, Rasheed Wallace, Vlade Divac and Dikembe Mutombo.(n)

programme.desc: A social satire in which two inept black FBI agents pose as spoiled white socialites to uncover a kidnapping plot.(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.
